uo.label: mole
uo.definition: A substance unit which is equal to the amount of substance of a molecular system which contains as many elementary entities as there are atoms in 0.012 kilogram of carbon 12.

uo.label: ampere
uo.definition: An electric current unit which is equal to the constant current which, if maintained in two straight parallel conductors of infinite length, of negligible circular cross-section, and placed 1 m apart in vacuum, would produce between these conductors a force equal to 2 x 10^[-7] newton per meter of length.

uo.label: meter
uo.definition: A length unit which is equal to the length of the path traveled by light in vacuum during a time interval of 1/299 792 458 of a second.

uo.label: candela
uo.definition: A luminous intensity unit which equal to the luminous intensity, in a given direction, of a source that emits monochromatic radiation of frequency 540 x 1012 hertz and that has a radiant intensity in that direction of 1/683 watt per steradian.

uo.label: kilogram
uo.definition: A mass unit which is equal to the mass of the International Prototype Kilogram kept by the BIPM at Svres, France.

uo.label: kelvin
uo.definition: A thermodynamic temperature unit which is equal to the fraction 1/273.16 of the thermodynamic temperature of the triple point of water.

uo.label: second
uo.definition: A time unit which is equal to the duration of 9 192 631 770 periods of the radiation corresponding to the transition between the two hyperfine levels of the ground state of the caesium 133 atom.
